title: How to Make Horseradish Vinegar

steps.headline: Put all the ingredients into a bottle.
Shake well every day for a fortnight (two weeks).
When it is thoroughly steeped, strain and bottle, and it will be fit for use immediately.
Peel the horseradish.
steps.description: Grate or shred it. Mince in a blender or food processor.

steps.headline: Add the minced horseradish to the vinegar in a glass bottle or a jar.
steps.description: Add sufficient vinegar to create a sauce. Shake well.

steps.headline: Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Dig out the horseradish tap roots.
steps.description: This is best done after the first frost.

steps.headline: Wash the taproots.
steps.description: Scrape off dirt and any hairy parts.

steps.headline: Add pieces of the horseradish taproot in batches to the blender or food processor.
steps.description: Add small amounts of vinegar for each batch, just enough to help the processing (about 1 tablespoon of vinegar per cup of horseradish pieces). Process or blend until pulped. The horseradish can make your eyes water when you remove the lid from the blender or processor.

steps.headline: Pour into a glass bottle or jar.
steps.description: Fill with vinegar. Or, fill ice cube trays with the processed horseradish and simply freeze (don't add any further vinegar). Add to freezer bags once the tray pieces freeze, and date and label the bags.

steps.headline: Use as needed.
steps.description: Store in a dark, dry place or in the fridge.

text: Horseradish and cayenne vinegar Put all the ingredients into a bottle.  Shake well every day for a fortnight (two weeks).  When it is thoroughly steeped, strain and bottle, and it will be fit for use immediately.  Plain horseradish vinegar Peel the horseradish. Grate or shred it. Mince in a blender or food processor. Add the minced horseradish to the vinegar in a glass bottle or a jar. Add sufficient vinegar to create a sauce. Shake well. Season to taste with salt and pepper.  Use within 3 days. Keep refrigerated when not using. Horseradish taproots vinegar Dig out the horseradish tap roots. This is best done after the first frost. Wash the taproots. Scrape off dirt and any hairy parts. Chop into pieces or slices.  Add pieces of the horseradish taproot in batches to the blender or food processor. Add small amounts of vinegar for each batch, just enough to help the processing (about 1 tablespoon of vinegar per cup of horseradish pieces). Process or blend until pulped. The horseradish can make your eyes water when you remove the lid from the blender or processor. Pour into a glass bottle or jar. Fill with vinegar. Or, fill ice cube trays with the processed horseradish and simply freeze (don't add any further vinegar). Add to freezer bags once the tray pieces freeze, and date and label the bags. Use as needed. Store in a dark, dry place or in the fridge.
